snippet: Isaac Herzog, the leader of Israel’s center-left Labor Party, and Tzipi Livni, the recently dismissed justice minister, announced on Wednesday that they would form an alliance to challenge Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in elections next March.
abstract: Isaac Herzog, leader of Israel’s center-left Labor Party, and Tzipi Livni, dismissed justice minister and leader of small centrist faction, say they will run on joint slate in March elections in bid to prevent Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu from winning a fourth term.
lead_paragraph: Isaac Herzog, the leader of Israel’s center-left Labor Party, and Tzipi Livni, the recently dismissed justice minister, announced on Wednesday that they would form an alliance to challenge Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu in elections next March.

headline.main: Alliance Adds Twist to Israeli Elections
headline.print_headline: Alliance Adds Twist to Israeli Elections
